definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I stirred up the cinders, and fetched a scuttleful myself.
sentences.chinese: 我攪動一下那些餘燼，自己去取了一煤斗的煤。

sentences.english: He called to the hostler to fetch a peck of oysters , and give them to his horse .
sentences.chinese: 於是，他讓旅店裏的馬倌去取些牡蠣來喂他的馬。

sentences.english: The next morning Alen insisted on driving me to the car shop.
sentences.chinese: 第二天一大早，Alen堅持要送我去取車。

sentences.english: Can I pick up my Corporate Purchase at my eslite bookstore?
sentences.chinese: 可以到誠品書店的門市去取企業團購的商品嗎？

sentences.english: May I go with you to claim my luggage?
sentences.chinese: 請問我能和你一起去取行李嗎？

sentences.english: Wolff reached for his drink and drained the glass.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾夫伸手去取杯子，然後一飲而盡。

sentences.english: I'll send a bellman up to get your luggage.
sentences.chinese: 我馬上叫走李員上去取您的行李。

sentences.english: I lost something in the waiting area. Can I go get it?
sentences.chinese: 我把一些東西遺失在候機室了，我能不能去取回來？

sentences.english: He’s amazingly reliable, so I generally go fetch it myself.
sentences.chinese: 他是令人驚奇地可靠，所以我總是自己去取。

sentences.english: 'Go and get your clothes, you wicked girl, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: “去取你的衣服，你這個混賬丫頭，”他說。

sentences.english: Tweener went to get the tools that Scofield listed for him.
sentences.chinese: 特威納去取斯科菲爾德給他列出來的工具了。

sentences.english: He called to the hostler to fetch a peck of oysters , give them to his horse .
sentences.chinese: 於是，他讓旅店裏的馬倌去取些牡蠣來喂他的馬。

sentences.english: The king sent people to get the yellow mare, but found it a black colt.
sentences.chinese: 秦穆公派人去取馬，沒想到是一匹黑色的雄馬。

sentences.english: I left my bag at grandma's house yesterday; I will go and get it when I am free.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天把手袋落在奶奶家了，我有空兒就去取。

sentences.english: She remembered that she had gone "one day, at night," to fetch water in a forest.
sentences.chinese: 她還記得“某天晚上”她曾到一個樹林裏去取過水。

sentences.english: He hurried home to get his patrol car.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速的跑回家去取他的巡邏警車。

definition: to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
to go on a journey/to leave
erhua variant of 等一會|等一会[deng3 yi1 hui4]
to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
in a moment/later/also pr. [dai1 hui3 r5] or [dai1 hui5 r5]
you all (archaic)/see also 你們|你们[ni3 men5]
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
